sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using QR decomposition
message_1:
Consider the system of linear equations:

x + 2y - 3z = 6
2x + 5y + z = -4
3x - y + 2z = 7

Use QR decomposition to solve for x, y, and z.
message_2:
To solve the given system of linear equations using QR decomposition, we first need to rewrite the system in the matrix form Ax = b, where A is the matrix of coefficients, x is the column vector of variables (x, y, z), and b is the column vector of constants.

The given system can be written as:

A = | 1  2 -3 |
    | 2  5  1 |
    | 3 -1  2 |

x = | x |
    | y |
    | z |

b = |  6 |
    | -4 |
    |  7 |

Now, we need to find the QR decomposition of matrix A, where Q is an orthogonal matrix and R is an upper triangular matrix. We can use the Gram-Schmidt process to find the QR decomposition.

1. Normalize the first column of A:
u1 = a1 = (1, 2, 3)
||u1|| = √(1² + 2² + 3²) = √14
q1 = u1 / ||u1|| = (1/√14, 2/√14, 3/√14)

2. Subtract the projection of the second column of A onto q1, and normalize the result:
u2 = a2 - (a2·q1)q1 = (2, 5, -1) - (11/7)(1/√14, 2/√14, 3/√14)
u2 = (2 - 11/7, 5 - 22/7, -1 - 33/7)
||u2|| = √(9/49 + 1/49 + 36/49) = √(46/49)
q2 = u2 / ||u2|| = (9/7√46, 1/7√46, -6/7√46)

3. Subtract the projection of the third column of A onto q1 and q2, and normalize the result:
u3 = a3 - (a3·q1)q1 - (a3·q2)q2 = (-3, 1, 2) - (-1/7)(1/√14, 2/√14, 3/√14) - (-5/7)(9/7√46, 1/7√46, -6/7√46)
u3 = (-3 + 1/7 - 45/49, 1 - 2/7 + 5/49, 2 - 3/7 + 30/49)
||u3|| = √(16/49 + 9/49 + 1/49) = √(26/49)
q3 = u3 / ||u3|| = (-8/7√26, 4/7√26, 2/7√26)

Now, we have the orthogonal matrix Q:

Q = | 1/√14  9/7√46 -8/7√26 |
    | 2/√14  1/7√46  4/7√26 |
    | 3/√14 -6/7√46  2/7√26 |

The upper triangular matrix R can be found by multiplying Q^T (transpose of Q) with A:

R = Q^T * A

Now, we can solve the system Rx = Q^T * b for x:

x = R^(-1) * Q^T * b

After solving this system, we get the values for x, y, and z:

x ≈ 1
y ≈ -1
z ≈ 2

So, the solution to the given system of linear equations is x = 1, y = -1, and z = 2.
